definition-item.definition-title: DRYING SOLID MATERIALS OR OBJECTS BY REMOVING LIQUID THEREFROM (racks for drying fruit and vegetables A01F25/12; drying foodstuffs A23; drying hair A45D20/00; body-drying implements A47K10/00; drying household articles A47L, {e.g. drying footwear A47L23/20; } drying gases and vapours B01D; chemical and physical processes for dewatering or like separating liquids from solids B01D43/00; centrifugal apparatus B04; drying ceramics C04B33/30; drying yarns and fabrics in association with some other form of treatment D06C; drying frames for laundry without heating or positive air circulation, domestic and like spin-dryers, wringing and hot pressing laundry D06F; furnaces, kilns, ovens F27; {treatment including a drying step of semiconductor substrates, e.g. wafers, H01L21/67028})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes and specific machines and arrangements for drying objects, solid materials or fluent materials containing solids by removing water or other liquids therefrom.

table-column.paragraph-text: Processing, e.g. drying of harvested produce
Dairy products
Food and foodstuffs; their treatment, e.g. drying
Drying household articles
Drying gases and vapours
Physical Processes and their relevant apparatus
Centrifuges
Preparation or pre-treatment, e.g. drying, of plastics to be shaped
Presses in general
Cement Making
Drying of peat
Fuels, e.g. solid fuels not otherwise provided for
Drying yarns or fabrics in association with some other form of treatment
Drying textile articles
Production of cellulose, e.g. pulp
Impregnating or coating of paper
Regulating or controlling combustion
Feeding fuel to combustion apparatus
F23K and F23K
Drying, conditioning of air in general
Heat cycles, refrigeration
Furnaces, kilns, ovens in general
Details of furnaces, kilns and ovens in general
Cables, conductors and insulators
Capacitors
Feeding waste products to combustion apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying gases and vapours
Evaporating of liquids
Treatment including a drying step of semiconductor substrates, e.g. wafers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preservation of foodstuff by drying
Apparatus for preserving meat, fish, eggs, fruit, vegetables by drying
Apparatus for preserving meat, fish, eggs, fruit, vegetables by freeze drying
Machines for drying or roasting fruits or vegetables, e.g. coffee, cocoa, nuts
Drying and activating adhesives in the process of glueing shoe parts
Drying of shoes during manufacture
Drying Hair
Drying razor blades
Body Drying Implements
Drying footwear
Physical or chemical process or apparatus in general for separating liquids from solids
Drying of gases, i.e. removing vapour, e.g. water vapour
Treating solid materials in general with rotating drums
Drying grain before milling
Pre- or after-treatment, e.g. drying or curing, of surfaces to which liquids, e.g. coatings or paints, are applied
Auxiliary treatment of plastic granules, i.e. after making them
Drying plastic pellets, e.g. before the extruder
Apparatus for making layered products for laminating, e.g. by curing or drying
Drying vehicle bodies, e.g. cars, after washing
Drying of sludge
Drying clay wares
Drying of matches
Drying or dewatering of peat
Drying apparatus for fuels
Torrefying apparatus for fuels
Heating solid fuel briquettes of mineral origin
Solid biofuels
Drying leather or hides as part of the manufacturing process
Drying of retted fibres
Forcing gases through textile materials
Removing liquids from textile materials in association with previous liquid treatment
Supporting means for linen or garments to be dried
Domestic laundry dryer, e.g. tumbler
De-watering of pulp
Machines for preparing, e.g. heating and drying, of paving materials for roads
Apparatus for drying pavement
Drying of constructions, e.g. buildings, and keeping them dry
Drying of waste products by heat prior to combustion
Dewatering of waste products by mechanical means prior to combustion
Preparation of solid fuel prior to combustion, e.g. drying
Drying of solid fuel prior combustion
Equipment for the use of solar heat
Drying of photographic film in processing apparatus
Drying step in manufacturing of electric cables
Drying step in manufacturing of electric insulators
Drying of, e.g. oil cooled, transformers
Drying, filling, purifying of, e.g. oil cooled, transformers
Drying step in manufacturing capacitors
Production of biofuels through pyrolysis

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents dealing with drying specific solid materials or objects belonging to other subclasses are classified in F26B only, if the disclosed drying process or machine is of general interest, i.e. not limited to the specific solid material or object.

definition-item.definition-title: Preliminary treatment of solid materials or objects to facilitate drying {, e.g. mixing or backmixing the materials to be dried with predominantly dry solids (F26B5/005 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preliminary treatment, i.e. not the actual drying treatment, of solid materials or objects.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applying a combustible liquid, which is burnt off later, onto the solid materials or objects
Dipping the solid materials or objects into, or mixing with, chemical liquids for subsequent drying

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Replacing liquid in wet solids by other liquid

definition-item.definition-title: Drying solid materials or objects by processes involving the application of heat (in specific machines or apparatus F26B9/00 - F26B19/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Drying solid materials or objects by processes applying heat as primary drying principle.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes involving direct heating, e.g. radiation, or indirect heating, e.g. convection, of the drying good merely as a measure to compensate cooling effects through evaporation, e.g. in a vacuum dryer
Heat generated by friction through ultrasonic vibrations
Condensing vapour other than steam onto the surface of the materials or objects to be dried

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preserving food in general by spray drying
Spray drying liquids
Spray drying liquid solutions to obtain solids
Fluidised bed technique in general
UV-curing of paint
Equipment for the use of solar heat
Magnetrons for drying

section-body.paragraph-text: Specific machines or apparatus (F26B9/00 - F26B19/00) being inherent to the process take precedence.
Therefore, inventions are additionally classified in F26B3/00 only, if the invention information lies within the process as such.
In any case, inventions are classified in F26B3/00, if adequate entries, i.e. classes, for machines or apparatuses do not exist.

definition-item.definition-title: so as to loosen them, e.g. to form a fluidised bed {("fluidised-bed" technique in general B01J8/24; centrifugal fluidised beds F26B7/007)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Centrifugal fluidised beds

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluidised bed technique in general

definition-item.definition-title: in the form of a spray {, i.e. sprayed or dispersed emulsions or suspensions (spray drying of solutions B01D1/18)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Freeze drying involving spraying
Preserving food in general by spray drying
Spray drying liquids
Spray drying liquids or solutions to obtain solids

definition-item.definition-title: by radiation, e.g. from the sun

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heated fluid, other than combustion gases, in tubes or passages acting as radiative element
UV-curing of paint
Equipment for the use of solar heat

definition-item.definition-title: Electromagnetic heating, e.g. induction heating or heating using microwave energy

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Magnetrons for drying

definition-item.definition-title: Drying solid materials or objects by processes not involving the application of heat (separating liquids from solids by straining B01D; replacing liquids in wet solids by other liquids, e.g. water by spirit, B01D12/00; drying by electrophoresis B01J)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Drying solid materials or objects by processes applying a primary drying principle not involving heat.

Direct heating, e.g. radiation, or indirect heating, e.g. convection, of the drying good as measure to compensate cooling effects through evaporation are not considered to be a primary drying principle.
Separating a liquid product from solids by straining: B01D
Drying by electrophoresis: B01J
Centrifuges in general; details of construction:B04B
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preserving food in general by freeze drying
Apparatus for preserving meat, fish, eggs, fruit, vegetables by freeze drying
Domestic salad spin dryer
Replacing liquid in wet solids by other liquid
Physical or chemical process or apparatus for separating liquids from solids, in general
Centrifuges, details of construction
Metal rolling; removing liquids
Presses for squeezing out liquids
Cleaning, e.g. drying paint applying hand tools
Drying of peat using presses, rolls or centrifuges
Wringing machines for textile articles with two or more cooperating rollers
Apparatus of the press type for expelling water from textile articles
Domestic spin dryers for textile articles
Wet end, e.g. filter belt type, of machines for making a continuous web of paper
Drying of constructions or buildings using electricity, e.g. electro-osmosis
Dewatering of waste products by mechanical means prior to combustion

definition-item.definition-title: {by dipping them into or mixing them with a chemical liquid, e.g. organic; chemical, e.g. organic, dewatering aids (F26B3/005 takes precedence; using chemical vapours or gases F26B21/14)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
by dipping them into or mixing them with a chemical liquid, e.g. organic; chemical, e.g. organic, dewatering aids
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applying a combustible liquid onto the material, the liquid being burnt off subsequently
Condensing vapour other than steam onto the surface of the material to be dried

table-column.paragraph-text: Replacing liquid in wet solids by other liquid

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preserving food in general by freeze drying
Apparatus for preserving meat, fish, eggs, fruit, vegetables by freeze drying

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Domestic salad spin dryer
Centrifuges
Cleaning, e.g. drying paint applying hand tools
Drying of peat using centrifuges
Domestic spin dryers for textile articles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for drying material of long length with progressive movement by applying suction

table-column.paragraph-text: Metal rolling; removing liquids
Wet end, e.g. filter belt type, of machines for making a continuous web of paper

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for drying material of long length with progressive movement by applying pressure, brushing or wiping

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metal rolling; removing liquids
Presses for squeezing out liquids
Drying of peat using presses or rolls
Wringing machines for textile articles with two or more cooperating rollers
Apparatus of the press type for expelling water from textile articles
Wet end, e.g. filter belt type, of machines for making a continuous web of paper

definition-item.definition-title: by contact with sorbent bodies, e.g. absorbent mould; by admixture with sorbent materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for drying material of long length with progressive movement by employing sorbent surfaces

definition-item.definition-title: Drying solid materials or objects by processes using a combination of processes not covered by a single one of groups F26B3/00 and F26B5/00 {(F26B1/005, F26B5/04, F26B23/026 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Drying solid materials or objects by processes using a synergy creating combination, opposed to a simple agglomeration, of a heat applying "hot" process and a "cold" process.
Documents classified in the combination group F26B7/00 are also to be classified in the relevant "hot" group F26B3/00, F26B9/00 - F26B19/00 respectively, and the relevant "cold" group F26B5/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials or objects at rest or with only local agitation; Domestic airing cupboards {(domestic laundry drying cabinets or chambers having heating or ventilating means D06F58/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines or apparatus for drying "large" objects at rest.
Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials or "small" objects, e.g. bulk materials at rest or with local agitation, e.g. fixed or moving "small" stirrer in a "large" silo.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilating means for stacks of agricultural products
Machines for drying or roasting fruits or vegetables, e.g. coffee, cocoa, nuts
Drying Hair
Drying razor blades
Body Drying Implements
Large containers having means for heating, cooling, aerating or other conditioning of contents
Supporting means for linen or garments to be dried
Domestic laundry drying cabinets
Drying or keeping dry of constructions, e.g. buildings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying razor blades

definition-item.definition-title: {Removable covering devices, e.g. pliable or flexible}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofs of drying chambers

definition-item.definition-title: in the open air; in pans or tables in rooms; Drying stacks of loose material {on floors which may be covered, e.g. by a roof (ventilating means of stacks for agricultural produce A01F25/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilating means for stacks of agricultural products

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials or objects with movement which is non-progressive

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials or objects with primarily non-progressive, i.e. stirring, movement.
The movement of solid materials in e.g. horizontal rotating drums such as kilns is considered not primarily progressive even though opposed inlets and outlets are typically present.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treating in general with rotating drums
Machines for preparing, e.g. heating and drying, of paving materials for roads

definition-item.definition-title: in moving drums or other mainly-closed receptacles (F26B11/18 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treating in general with rotating drums
Machines for preparing, e.g. heating and drying, of paving materials for roads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Driving arrangements specific to drying machines in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for gas-sealing the drum}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Seals, locks for drying machines in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for charging or discharging the materials to be dried, e.g. discharging by reversing drum rotation, using spiral-type inserts}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Charging and discharging of bulk materials to drying machines in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for the supply or exhaust of gaseous drying medium for direct heat transfer, e.g. perforated tubes, annular passages, burner arrangements, dust separation, combined direct and indirect heating}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Arrangement for the supply or exhaust of gaseous drying medium for direct heat transfer, e.g. perforated tubes, annular passages, burner arrangements, dust separation, combined direct and indirect heat transfer
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for supplying drying gas in general

definition-item.definition-title: rotating about a horizontal or slightly-inclined axis {(F26B11/022, F26B11/024, F26B11/026, F26B11/028 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for preparing, e.g. heating and drying, of paving materials for roads

definition-item.definition-title: Machines and apparatus for drying fabrics, fibres, yarns, or other materials in long lengths, with progressive movement

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines and apparatus for drying materials in long length. The materials move progressively through the apparatus either in the form of a coil or uncoiled, e.g. in the form of a web.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying yarn hanks

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying fishing lines
Apparatus for making layered products for laminating, e.g. by curing or drying
Treating, e.g. drying, webs after printing
Drying filamentary material, e.g. sheets, webs or cables during package formation
Drying yarns during spinning or twisting
Forcing gases through textile materials
Removing liquids from textile materials in association with previous liquid treatment
Wet end, e.g. filter belt type, of machines for making a continuous web of paper
Dryer sections of machines for making a continuous web of paper
Paper-impregnating material characterized by its constitution
Paper-impregnating material characterized by its function, form or properties
Drying step in manufacturing of cables
Drying step in manufacturing of insulators

definition-item.definition-title: {Seals, locks, e.g. gas barriers for web drying enclosures}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Seal, looks in drying apparatus in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying process by contact with sorbent bodies

definition-item.definition-title: for applying pressure; for brushing; for wiping

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying process applying pressure, brushing, wiping

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or apparatus for drying objects with progressive movement; Machines or apparatus with progressive movement for drying batches of material in compact form (F26B13/00, F26B17/00 take precedence; conveyors in general B65G)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines or apparatus for drying objects or object-like batches, e.g. material in a container.
The objects or batches move progressively through the machine or apparatus.

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or apparatus for drying materials in loose, plastic, or fluidised form, e.g. granules, staple fibres, with progressive movement (F26B13/00 takes precedence {; feed or discharge arrangements F26B25/002})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines or apparatus for drying materials in loose form, plastic or fluidized form.
The materials move progressively through the machine or apparatus.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines with primarily non-progressive movement of materials, e.g. mixing of materials
Fibres forming a material of long length, e.g. yarn, web

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for drying or roasting fruits or vegetables, e.g. coffee, cocoa, nuts
Drying tobacco
Drying grain before milling
Treatment, e.g. drying of wood particles in the production of pressed articles, e.g. boards

section-body.paragraph-text: The movement of materials through rotating drums, e.g. kiln, is considered non-progressive; rotating drums are therefore classified in F26B11/00

definition-item.definition-title: with movement performed by belts carrying the materials; with movement performed by belts {or elements attached to endless belts or chains} propelling the materials over stationary surfaces {(the movement being in a helical path F26B15/26; F26B17/003, F26B17/263 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Process with stationary surface conducting heat

definition-item.definition-title: with movement performed by fluid currents, e.g. issuing from a nozzle, {e.g. pneumatic, flash, vortex or entrainment dryers} (F26B3/08 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus using free vortex flow for separating in general

definition-item.definition-title: {pneumatically inducing within the drying enclosure a curved flow path, e.g. circular, spiral, helical; Cyclone or Vortex dryers (swirl or curved flow path induced mechanically, i.e. by rotating element F26B3/0923)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying processes for loose materials involving a fluidised bed

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Jet Mills, e.g. for drying and milling, having a cyclone or vortex type flow pattern
Apparatus using free vortex flow for separating in general

definition-item.definition-title: the materials moving through a counter-current of gas

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying plastic pellets, e.g. before the extruder

definition-item.definition-title: with movement performed by shooting or throwing the materials {, e.g. after which the materials are subject to impact (F26B17/108 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary treatment of plastic granules, e.g. after making them

definition-item.definition-title: with movement performed by reciprocating or oscillating conveyors propelling materials over stationary surfaces; with movement performed by reciprocating or oscillating shelves, sieves, or trays {(F26B17/006 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary treatment of plastic granules, e.g. after making them

definition-item.definition-title: Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials or objects not covered by groups F26B9/00 - F26B17/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Miscellaneous machines and machines of any type for drying solid materials or objects featuring a self contained mobile arrangement, the drying taking place with the mobile machine at rest or with moving machine, e.g. moving along or around the large object to be dried.
Combinations of two or more non-mobile machines individually covered by groups F26B9/00 - F26B17/00 to be classified in F26B20/00.
Self contained mobile devices to be classified also in the relevant "stationary" groups F26B9/00 - F26B19/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {Self-contained mobile devices, e.g. for agricultural produce (movable devices with radiation means F26B3/28; small self-contained devices for drying objects at rest F26B9/003)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Small self-contained devices for drying objects at rest

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Movable devices with radiation means
Harvester with Dryer
Large containers having means for heating, cooling, aerating or other conditioning of contents
Apparatus for drying pavement
Drying, or keeping dry, of constructions, e.g. buildings

definition-item.definition-title: Combinations of machines or apparatus covered by two or more of groups F26B9/00 - F26B19/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Combinations of machines or apparatus, either creating a synergetic effect or being a simple agglomeration, covered by two or more of groups F26B9/00 - F26B19/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements {or duct systems, e.g. in combination with pallet boxes,} for supplying and controlling air or gases for drying solid materials or objects ({F26B9/10 takes precedence; systems for vehicle body drying B60S3/002} ; air conditioning or ventilation in general F24F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements for supplying drying air or gases or steam to the drying apparatus or directly to (or into) the object or solid materials.
Arrangements for routing and circulating the drying air or gases or steam.
Arrangements for controlling the properties of drying air or gases or steam.
Condensing vapour other than steam onto the surface of the materials or objects to be dried.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or apparatus for drying solid materials in the open air or in large rooms featuring drying air supply arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes condensing steam onto the surface of the materials or objects to be dried
Details, component parts of blowers in general
Valves in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Drying-air generating units, e.g. movable, independent of drying enclosure}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for drying pavement
Drying of constructions, e.g. buildings

definition-item.definition-title: {the gas supply or exhaust being effected through hollow spaces or cores in the materials or objects, e.g. tubes, pipes, bottles (F26B9/003 and F26B9/103 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Small self contained devices
Drying air channels placed in a stack

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying footwear

definition-item.definition-title: {the objects being flexible articles, which may be blown up by the drying gas, e.g. tubes, sausage casings (fire hoses A62C33/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying fire hoses
Providing support for textile articles to be dried, such as garments, gloves or stockings

definition-item.definition-title: Humidity

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separation of gases and vapours by absorption in general
Drying gases

definition-item.definition-title: {by using sorbent or hygroscopic materials, e.g. chemical substances, molecular sieves}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separation of gases and vapors by adsorption in general
Drying gases by adsorption

definition-item.definition-title: {by condensing the moisture in the drying medium, which may be recycled, e.g. using a heat pump cycle}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treatment of dryer exhaust gas by e.g. condensation
Solvent recovery by condensation
Solvent recovery by sublimation
Separation of gases and vapours by condensation in general
Drying gases by condensation

definition-item.definition-title: {Condensing the vapour onto the surface of the materials to be dried (using condensing steam F26B3/00; using chemical liquids F26B5/005)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes condensing steam onto the surface of the materials or objects to be dried

definition-item.definition-title: Heating arrangements ({by radiation, e.g. infrared, ultraviolet, solar F26B3/28 and F26B3/30}; using heated air or gases F26B21/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Heating arrangements providing a heat source for drying machines, located outside or within the drying enclosure.Drying air, gas, steam or vapour supply arrangements.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Radiation heating the drying good

definition-item.definition-title: {using waste heat}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Waste heat recuperation with combustion

definition-item.definition-title: using combustion heating ({F26B3/305, F26B13/186, F26B21/001, } F26B23/10 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combustion for generating IR radiation, either through flame radiation or combustion heated tubes
Heating rollers for drying materials of long length
Drying-air generating units

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements of gas flames for drying materials of long length
Waste combustion control aspects
Regulating or controlling combustion

definition-item.definition-title: {using solid fuel; burning the dried product}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Using combustion flue gas to predry fuel

definition-item.definition-title: Details of general application not covered by group F26B21/00 or F26B23/00 (loading, conveying, and unloading in general B65G)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details of machines or processes other than arrangements of drying air or gas supply or heating arrangements such as:
Cleaning arrangements, e.g. for drying chambers.
Loading, unloading and other handling of objects or materials to be dried or dried.
Treatment of dryer exhaust gases.
Seals, locks and air curtains for drying enclosures.
Alarm, safety and fire protection systems.
Driving mechanisms specific for drying machines.
Agitating, stirring or scraping devices.
Drying chambers and parts thereof.
Rollers, e.g. for conveying specific to drying machines and their requirements.
Controlling the drying process depending on the liquid content of dried material or wet material being charged.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Driving mechanisms for rotary drums, e.g. kiln
Arrangements for gas sealing drum dryers, e.g. kilns
Loading and unloading materials in rotary drums, e.g. kilns
Seals, locks for web drying enclosures
Rollers and driving mechanisms for rollers for drying material of long length
Treatment of dryer exhaust gas through incineration of volatiles
Loading and unloading of wicket conveyor
Material feeding means for pneumatic, flash or vortex dryers
Safety and fire protection system using inert gases
Driving mechanisms covered by another subclass, e.g. regarding centrifuges

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mixing or backmixing of wet materials to be charged, thus changing the liquid content
Drying process involving brushing or wiping
Stationary drying chamber with mechanical agitating device
Loading and unloading materials in rotary drums, e.g. kilns
Moving stirring devices in stationary drums
Moving stirring devices in stationary dishes, tray or pans
Arrangements for wiping material of long length, e.g. webs
Scraping device to remove dried material from roller or disc, e.g. doctor blade
Large containers having means for heating, cooling, aerating or other conditioning of contents
Loading, conveying and unloading in general
Driving mechanisms in connection with general conveying machines

definition-item.definition-title: {for bulk goods (F26B17/103 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loading and unloading materials in rotary drums, e.g. kilns
Material feeding means for pneumatic, flash or vortex dryers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loading and unloading materials in rotary drums, e.g. kilns
Material feeding means for pneumatic, flash or vortex dryers
Devices for feeding particles into and evacuation of particles out of the reactor

definition-item.definition-title: {Seals, locks, e.g. gas barriers or air curtains, for drying enclosures (F26B11/024 and F26B13/005 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for gas sealing drum dryers, e.g. kilns
Seals, locks for web drying enclosures

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Seals in general
